intro: Paphiopedilum tranlienianum f. alboviride, commonly known as the alboviride lady's slipper orchid, is a rare and striking orchid species native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its unique, intricate flower structure with a pouch-like lip that serves as a pollination trap. The plant typically grows as a terrestrial orchid, thriving in shaded, humid environments with well-draining soil. Its foliage consists of broad, dark green leaves, and it produces showy, often white or pale yellow flowers. Due to its rarity and ornamental value, it is highly sought after in horticultural circles.
